jmortgage.pmi
Class DefaultPMICalculator

java.lang.Object
  jmortgage.pmi.DefaultPMICalculator
All Implemented Interfaces:
PMICalculator
public class DefaultPMICalculator
extends Object
implements PMICalculator

A simple PMI calculator. The amount to pay is based on the percentage of the home's value paid down. If the down payment is less than 20%, the borrower has to pay a monthly PMI amount.

Since:
1.2
Author:
David Armstrong

Field Summary
static double DFLT_FIFTEEN_PCT_DIVIDER
          The default amount by which to divide the loan amount if the down payment amount is less than 20 percent and more than or equal to 15 percent.
static double DFLT_FIVE_PCT_DIVIDER
          The default amount by which to divide the loan amount if the down payment amount is less than 10 percent.
static double DFLT_TEN_PCT_DIVIDER
          The default amount by which to divide the loan amount if the down payment amount is less than 15 percent and more than or equal to 10 percent.
 
Constructor Summary
DefaultPMICalculator()
          Creates a new instance of DefaultPMICalculator using the default values for five, ten, and fifteen percent down dividers.

          Creates a new instance of DefaultPMICalculator with the specified five, ten, and fifteen percent dividers.

          Creates a new instance of DefaultPMICalculator with the specified five, ten, and fifteen percent dividers.
 
Method Summary
 double calcPMI(double homeValue, double amtDown)
          Calculates the PMI if the amount down is less than 20% of the home value.

Constructor Detail

DefaultPMICalculator

public DefaultPMICalculator()
Creates a new instance of DefaultPMICalculator using the default values for five, ten, and fifteen percent down dividers.

DefaultPMICalculator

public DefaultPMICalculator(Double fivePctDivider,
                            Double tenPctDivider,
                            Double fifteenPctDivider)
Creates a new instance of DefaultPMICalculator with the specified five, ten, and fifteen percent dividers. This constructor is available for the benefit of JMortgageFactory, which uses reflection to build objects. Reflection will not find constructors that take primitives as arguments.

Parameters:
fivePctDivider - The amount by which to divide the loan amount if the down payment amount is less than 10 percent.
tenPctDivider - The amount by which to divide the loan amount if the down payment amount is less than 15 percent and more than or equal to 10 percent.
fifteenPctDivider - The default amount by which to divide the loan amount if the down payment amount is less than 20 percent and more than or equal to 15 percent.

DefaultPMICalculator

public DefaultPMICalculator(double fivePctDivider,
                            double tenPctDivider,
                            double fifteenPctDivider)
Creates a new instance of DefaultPMICalculator with the specified five, ten, and fifteen percent dividers.

Parameters:
fivePctDivider - The amount by which to divide the loan amount if the down payment amount is less than 10 percent.
tenPctDivider - The amount by which to divide the loan amount if the down payment amount is less than 15 percent and more than or equal to 10 percent.
fifteenPctDivider - The default amount by which to divide the loan amount if the down payment amount is less than 20 percent and more than or equal to 15 percent.
Method Detail

calcPMI

public double calcPMI(double homeValue,
                      double amtDown)
Calculates the PMI if the amount down is less than 20% of the home value.

Specified by:
calcPMI in interface PMICalculator
Parameters:
homeValue - The home's price
amtDown - The amount of the down payment
Returns:
the PMI value
